name: EncounterBusinessStatusAgedCare
title: Encounter Business Status (Aged Care / HACC)
description: Operational, workflow, and service episode statuses for aged care and home/community care encounters.

concept.definition: Initial stage of client onboarding where eligibility, needs, and consent are assessed.
Client is undergoing assessment to determine care needs, package level, or reassessment.
The care plan is being developed or adjusted in coordination with the client or providers.
The client’s care package is active and services are currently being delivered.
Routine care and services are being delivered as per the care plan.
The client’s care plan, health status, or funding package is being reviewed.
Service delivery temporarily paused (e.g., client hospitalisation, travel, short-term suspension).
The client is temporarily in a respite arrangement.
Preparing for conclusion of the care episode, transition, or transfer of services.
Care episode or encounter is fully complete and administratively closed.
Care episode ended prematurely by client or provider decision.
